page.title: 07Pendomer: Woodland
page.content: There are two principal areas of wood- land - Pen Wood, which is mainly coniferous, and Coker Wood where broadleaf trees predominate. In addition there are some small patches of wood which may have begun as fox coverts. Pen Wood belonged to the Forestry Commission until a year or two ago and was open to the public, with a car park, picnic site, footpaths and even an informative leaflet. It was a popular venue for school groups and others and it seems a pity that the present private owners, the pension fund of an industrial corporation, have not been able to continue to grant access, in an area where public open space is all too rare. Coker Wood is also privately managed and is not open.
